AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit famous relative
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] is the descendant, however distant, of a famed hobbit of local legend, or derives [PAWN_possessive] lineage from one of the many great hobbit families. [PAWN_pronoun] developed a silver spoon after socializing with countless distant relatives.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit know-it-all
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] had a gift for collecting things, keeping records, and recalling old legends of heroes and adventurers at a moment’s notice. [PAWN_possessive] desire to share [PAWN_possessive] knowledge made [PAWN_objective] somewhat of a conversationalist as well. [PAWN_pronoun] spent so much time observing and researching, however, that [PAWN_pronoun] was well known to fall over like an ent during any arm wrestling contests.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit troublemaker
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] spent [PAWN_possessive] childhood being a nuisance to [PAWN_possessive] neighbors and relatives. From years of running away from responsibilities, [PAWN_pronoun] learned how to be exceedingly fast, how to dodge incoming attacks, and how to escape from most of his potential captors.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit soft-spoken
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was well known for being an incredibly kind and thoughtful child. However, [PAWN_pronoun] spent most of [PAWN_possessive] time in social situations listening rather than speaking to avoid interrupting other people's trains of thought.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit mean-spirited
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] realized how to be the center of attention early on in life. Once [PAWN_pronoun] started saying mean things to others to make [PAWN_possessive] friends laugh, [PAWN_pronoun] learned two things. One, how to start fights. Two, how to make other hobbits cry.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit know-nothing
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] took pride in knowing as little as possible. [PAWN_possessive] parents assured [PAWN_objective] that so-called -learning- was just wasting valuable time [PAWN_pronoun] could be spending helping tend to the weeds. Intellectual and artistic disabled.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit grabby-hands
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: No matter how NAME’s parents tried, they could never get [PAWN_objective] to keep [PAWN_possessive] little hobbit hands to HIMself. [PAWN_pronoun] always wanted more of everything. Everything was -precious- to [PAWN_objective]. On the positive side, [PAWN_pronoun] learned quite a lot of survivalist cooking after being banished after one of his friends mysteriously drowned.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit clumsy-fool
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] broke dishes, burned meals, dropped lembas in mud, lost the sheep, forgot [PAWN_possessive] homework, swore in-front of grandma, shot dad in the rear-end with an arrow, and nearly died every season. How [PAWN_pronoun] has survived to adulthood is anyone’s guess.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit adventurer
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: It is a rare hobbit that leaves their home in search of fame and fortune in far flung lands. This makes [PAWN_nameDef] a bit queer in the eyes of [PAWN_possessive] fellow hobbits, yet [PAWN_pronoun] feels destined to go out there and back again.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit burglar
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Hobbits are quiet, nimble creatures when they put their minds to it. An expert burglar like [PAWN_nameDef] can make HIMself scarce when trouble arrives. Burglars are even rumored to be so skilled at thieving, they could even steal gold from 'neath a dragon's nose! But what are the chances of that?

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit drunk
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: A common sight among hobbits is the least industrious sort -- the drunkard. [PAWN_nameDef] called everyone his friend after a few drinks, and for years, [PAWN_pronoun] would wake up somewhere new every morning. [PAWN_pronoun] would gladly tell you the stories of his adventures, if [PAWN_pronoun] could remember any of them.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit gourmand
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Hobbits cannot stand for long without good cooking, and some, like the gourmand, demand only the best. [PAWN_nameDef] spent years leading cooks around by the nose and teaching others the ways to best cook food. Once [PAWN_possessive] popularity rose for critiquing cuisine, [PAWN_pronoun] took to eating food more than preparing it.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit layabout
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: It is well-known that hobbits are afforded a rather peaceful life. [PAWN_nameDef] was one of the layabouts -- the most sluggish of hobbits. [PAWN_pronoun] made it [PAWN_possessive] goal in life to simply have no goal -- complete leisure and relaxation in all things.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit farmer
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: How can a hobbit enjoy their second breakfast without farmers? [PAWN_nameDef] was born to till the soil. [PAWN_pronoun] has no time for shenanigans and is often very terse. Yet [PAWN_possessive] hard work shines through, as long as there aren't any Tooks about.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Hobbit gardener
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Hobbits also often take on simple occupations -- such as the gardener. [PAWN_nameDef] thrived amongst the golden mallorn flowers of the shire and always looked for just the right way to raise [PAWN_possessive] saplings and seedlings. Gardening wasn't just [PAWN_possessive] occupation, but it was [PAWN_possessive] muse.
